Hi All,

    I wanna say that I've been reviewing the archives
    before being mail bombed
    on "private & inner" references.

I've been working on my certif. assignement lately & have been confronted to
the following problem.
I've the "Flight by Night Cpy" to upgrade. The DB is now well enhenced &
contains a flush on close so the deleted records a re definitively removed,
etc...
Everything has been done in the almost purest JUnit style (must admit many
coding followed by testing, but there's none piping over my schoulder, so
;-) ).

I'd like now to change the accessor of some methods from public to
"friendly" or protected for some methods as they are not needed for the
caller anymore.
My question is twofold :
    1�. What are the possibilities ?
        Would simply moving the TestCase as inner
        class suite the matter.
    2�. Am I'm better to make all the TestCases member
        of the package of the class to test & make the accessor
        protected ?


Tx for advice,

Thomas,

p.s. :
To read with a sens of humour
I was wandering if some of the fossiles wagging around this web site could
lay down some of their best advices on testing private/protected methods &
testing with inner classes.





http://groups.yahoo.com/group/junit/message/3542

--
